text:
at would require immediate action. Ask the patient to return if she experiences:
o prolonged cramping (more than two days)
o prolonged bleeding (more than two weeks)
o bleeding more than a menstruation
o severe or increasing pain
o fever, chills or malaise
o fainting
• It is important to carefully document all actions, procedures and observations.
E
ctopic pregnancy 
• A woman with a positive pregnancy test and an acute abdomen mostly likely has a ruptured ectopic
pregnancy.
• T his  is a surgic
